title: Hotdog-Sandwich Unification Framework

prerequisites: Secure buy-in from key stakeholder groups
steps.outcome: Create a legitimate, authoritative body to define classification standards
risks: Difficulty getting all stakeholders to agree on council composition and decision-making process
Potential for council to be seen as biased or lacking legitimacy

prerequisites: Council has established its legitimacy and authority
steps.outcome: A framework that recognizes both structural and cultural dimensions of hotdog-sandwich taxonomy
risks: Potential for new system to be seen as overly complex or impractical

steps.action: Implement Dual Labeling and Dispute Resolution Mechanisms
prerequisites: Hybrid classification system is defined and accepted
steps.outcome: Allows for peaceful coexistence of differing viewpoints, with clear procedures for resolving disputes
risks: Resistance from stakeholders who want a single definitive answer
Potential for abuse of dispute resolution process

steps.action: Launch Public Education and Cultural Integration Campaign
prerequisites: Hybrid classification system and dispute resolution mechanisms are in place
steps.outcome: Increase public understanding and acceptance of the new framework, preventing escalation into broader food taxonomy conflicts
risks: Difficulty overcoming entrenched beliefs and biases
Potential for backlash from ideological purists on both sides

resource_requirements: Diverse stakeholder representation on classification council
Legal and regulatory expertise to establish framework
Public relations and communications resources for education campaign
Funding for council operations and public outreach
